case_vignette:
A 16-year-old male with past medical history of severe nodulocystic acne presents to the emergency room with increasing painful cysts on the trunk after recently starting oral isotretinoin in the past 3 weeks. Patient endorses fevers, chills, joint pain particularly along the chest. Examination reveals multiple inflammatory papules and large cystic nodules wih hemorrhagic crust on the chest, shoulders, and back. The sternum is tender to palpation. The patient is afebrile, but has a mild leukocytosis. The patient is admitted to the hospital for further evaluation and treatment.
Here is the text with all gender-specific references removed:
A 16-year-old patient with past medical history of severe nodulocystic acne presents to the emergency room with increasing painful cysts on the trunk after recently starting oral isotretinoin in the past 3 weeks. The patient endorses fevers, chills, joint pain particularly along the chest. Examination reveals multiple inflammatory papules and large cystic nodules with hemorrhagic crust on the chest, shoulders, and back. The sternum is tender to palpation. The patient is afebrile, but has a mild leukocytosis. The patient is admitted to the hospital for further evaluation and treatment.
